item.description: Agency Assist; INC#0724; 11:40AM; 820 S Broadway St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3WNoeij; #Downtown; PRELIM: Male (unknown age / site affiliation / time factor / circumstances) discovered deceased, trapped at 2nd floor level freight elevator doorway at the rear of a 6 story commercial building. LAFD responders will assist the Coroner's Office with the safe, discreet and dignified recovery of his remains. No further details. Media Inquiries: LAPD Central Division (Incident #1725) and Coroner.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E205 E227 E9 EM11 HR3 RA15 RA3 RA803 T27 T5 T9 UR88; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

Rescue; INC#0474; 09:26AM; 5460 W Hollywood Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3i9pM7h; #EastHollywood; PRELIM: One adult male, conscious and alert with undetermined injury, was found wedged beneath subway station platform at Hollywood/Western Metro Station, after possibly being struck by (unknown direction) B (Red) Line subway train, which remained at scene. The man was not physically trapped by the train. He has been safely extricated and is being medically evaluated by LAFD responders. His site affiliation and the circumstances of his being at track level have yet to be determined. No other injuries reported. Metro B Line Riders: Follow @MetroLAAlerts on Twitter (https://twitter.com/MetroLAAlerts) for any service related information. Media Inquiries: Metro and LAPD Transit Services Bureau (Incident #1184).; FS 82; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC11 BC13 BC5 E215 E227 E26 E287 E41 E56 E82 EM11 HR3 RA52 SQ87 T15 T27 T87 UR27 UR88; CH7; 15; Brian Humphrey

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#1222; 07:29PM; 114 Ucla; MAP: https://bit.ly/3WJ9XDa; Westwood; After a thorough search and investigation, all floors were cleared and no hazardous materials located. It is believed a refrigerant leak was the cause of the odor. No further details.; FS 71; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 BC9 E21 E221 E237 E295 E71 E95 EM9 JT6 RA37 RA71 RA95 SQ21 SQ95 T21 T37 T95; CH7; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#1222; 06:11PM; 114 Ucla; MAP: https://bit.ly/3WJ9XDa; Westwood; HazMat Squad investigated and determined there was no HazMat protocol required, firefighters will continue the investigation using standard personal protective equipment (PPE). No further details.; FS 71; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 BC9 E21 E221 E237 E295 E71 E95 EM9 JT6 RA37 RA71 RA95 SQ21 SQ95 T21 T37 T95; CH7; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

Hazardous Materials; INC#1222; 05:30PM; 114 Ucla; MAP: https://bit.ly/3WJ9XDa; Westwood; A UCLA officer investigated an alarm (chemical smell) in a building on campus began feeling unwell. Firefighters are investigated for a possible leak of unknown substance. There are no other patients. The officer exited the building on their own and is alert and oriented - possible precautionary hospital transport. No further details.; FS 71; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 E237 E295 E71 E95 EM9 JT6 RA37 RA71 RA95 SQ95 T37 T95; CH7; 13 14; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1021; 03:39PM; 2706 E 4th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3VJEIXc; Boyle Heights; KNOCKDOWN: 26 firefighters extinguished the fire in 17 minutes with no injuries reported. The fire was contained to a small (approx 900 sq ft) house to the rear of the reporting address. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E2 E202 E25 E4 RA2 RA25 T2; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1021; 03:22PM; 2706 E 4th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3VJEIXc; Boyle Heights; A single family dwelling to the back of the reporting address, with heavy smoke showing. Firefighters are in the offensive mode. ; FS 2; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E2 E202 E25 E4 RA2 T2; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Hazardous Materials; INC#0681; 12:39PM; 1130 E 18th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3WY0urd; Downtown; The product is confirmed to be hand sanitizer, which is clean burning. The safest operation is to allow the product to burn off while ensuring it does not damage any vehicles, etc. This will help to limit the water run off which is being contained by a damming operation. There are no injuries reported. This will be an extended duration and drivers are advised to avoid the area. The flames may also be visible from the freeway.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC13 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E209 E21 E221 E88 E9 EA1 EM1 HE2 JT6 RA209 SQ21 T21 T9; CH9; 15; Margaret Stewart

Hazardous Materials; INC#0681; 12:21PM; 1100 E 16th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/33I6Y3R; Downtown; It is a deep seated fire (not a large amount of active flames) within the pallets. As the HazMat squad is working to confirm the substance (believed to be hand sanitizer) and ensure there is nothing else present, firefighters (in full personal protective equipment) are using Class B foam to suppress the flammable vapors (it is lighter than water thus runs along top of the water flow) while limiting overall water usage (allowing the product to burn off). Sand is being ordered for a damming operation at Paloma St and 18th St towards E Washington Blvd. The CA Water Boards (State Water Resources Control Board) are notified regarding the watershed. LA County Department of Public Heath also notified. There were some vehicles exposed to the fire but firefighters moved them to a safer location. There are no injuries reported. Drivers are advised to avoid the area. ; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC13 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E209 E21 E221 E9 EM1 JT6 RA209 SQ21 T21 T9; CH9; 15; Margaret Stewart

HAZMAT; INC#0681; 11:45AM; 1100 E 16th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/33I6Y3R; Downtown; 30' x 100' pile of pallets on fire (pallets have boxes of ethanol) Fences will need to be breached and LAFD heavy equipment are responding to assist with moving the pallets. This original was reported as a rubbish fire and is now a HazMat response with additional resources requested (not yet reflected in this alert). No further details; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; E14; CH7; Margaret Stewart
